bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The American Friends of Russian Freedom was founded in 1891 in Boston, MA. The orgnaization supported the Russian opposition movement, broadly defined. A major campaign of the Amerian Friends of Russian Freedom was to oppose the U.S. ratification of the Russian Expedition Treaty, which allowed Russians residing in the U.S. to be extradited to face political charges in Russia.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of letters, clippings and pamphlets pertaining to the American Friends of Russian Freedom, and specifically the organization's opposition to the 1893 Russian Extradition Treaty.

userestrict.p: Materials in this collection, which were created in 1891-1896, are in the public domain. Permission to publish or reproduce is not required.
